Bool#false.description: Should.js Assertion#false. Assert given object is exactly false.

Bool#ok.description: Should.js Assertion#ok. Assert given object is thuthy according javascript type conversions.

Bool#true.description: Should.js Assertion#true. Assert given object is exactly true.

Contain#containDeep.description: Should.js Assertion#containDeep. Deep object equality comparison.

Contain#containDeepOrdered.description: Should.js Assertion#containDeepOrdered. Assert that given object is contain equally structured object on the same depth level.

Contain#containEql.description: Should.js Assertion#containEql. Assert that given object contain something that equal to other.

Equality#eql.description: Should.js Assertion#eql. Deep object equality comparison.

Equality#eqlNot.description: Should.js Assertion#eql (NOT). Deep object equality comparison.

Equality#oneOf.description: Should.js Assertion#oneOf. Exact comparison using .eql to be one of supplied objects.

Equality#equalOneOf.description: Should.js Assertion#equalOneOf. Exact comparison using === to be one of supplied objects.

Number#Infinity.description: Should.js Assertion#Infinity. Assert given object is not finite (positive or negative).

Number#NaN.description: Should.js Assertion#NaN. Assert given object is NaN.

Number#above.description: Should.js Assertion#above. Assert given number above n.

Number#aboveOrEqual.description: Should.js Assertion#aboveOrEqual. Assert given number above n.

Number#approximately.description: Should.js Assertion#approximately. Assert given number near some other value within delta.

Number#below.description: Should.js Assertion#below. Assert given number below n.

Number#belowOrEqual.description: Should.js Assertion#belowOrEqual. Assert given number below n.

Number#within.description: Should.js Assertion#within. Assert given number between start and finish or equal one of them.

Promise#Promise.description: Should.js Assertion#Promise. Assert given object is a Promise.

Promise#finally.description: Should.js Assertion#finally. Assert given object is promise and wrap it in PromisedAssertion, which has all properties of Assertion.

Promise#fulfilled.description: Should.js Assertion#fulfilled. Assert given promise will be fulfilled.

Promise#fulfilledWith.description: Should.js Assertion#fulfilledWith. Assert given promise will be fulfilled with some expected value (value compared using .eql).

Promise#rejected.description: Should.js Assertion#rejected. Assert given promise will be rejected.

Promise#rejectedWith.description: Should.js Assertion#rejectedWith. Assert given promise will be rejected with some sort of error.

Property#empty.description: Should.js Assertion#empty. Asserts given object is empty. For strings, arrays and arguments it checks .length property, for objects it checks keys.

Property#enumerable.description: Should.js Assertion#enumerable. Asserts given object has enumerable property with optionally value.

Property#enumerables.description: Should.js Assertion#enumerables. Asserts given object has enumerable properties.

Property#keys.description: Should.js Assertion#keys. Asserts given object has exact keys. Compared to properties, keys does not accept Object as a argument.

Property#length.description: Should.js Assertion#length. Asserts given object has property length with given value n.

Property#ownProperty.description: Should.js Assertion#length. Asserts given object has own property.
